section.title: Introduction
section.t: In pNFS, the file server returns typed layout structures that describe where file data is located. There are different layouts for different storage systems and methods of arranging data on storage devices. This document defines the layout used with file-based data servers that are accessed using the Network File System (NFS) Protocol: NFSv3 (), NFSv4 () and its newer minor version - NFSv4.1 ().

In contrast to the LAYOUT4_NFSV4_1_FILES layout type () that also uses NFSv4.1 to access the data server, the Flexible Files layout defines a model of device metadata and striping patterns that is inspired by the object layout () that provide flexible, per-file striping patterns and simple device information suitable aggregating standalone NFS servers into a centrally managed pNFS cluster.

To provide a global state model equivalent to that of the files layout a back-end control protocol may be implemented between the metadata server (MDS) and NFSv4.1 data servers (DSs). It is out of scope for this document to specify the wire protocol of such a protocol, yet the requirements for the protocol are specified in and clarified in .
